title: Fontname The Prague Post
content:
Can anyone help? What is the name of this font? ![logo the prague post](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054933im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32742.jpg)

 [‹ Please help ID this font - "Senna" logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054933/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4107 "Go to previous forum topic") [SWAT FONT? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054933/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4066 "Go to next forum topic")
author: steven12

comments.content:
Is this even a font? It could very well be custom designed;   
most newspaper nameplates are.

Thanx, but I don't think its a custom designed font (maybe a little), because the logo of Toppharm is the same. Only the T is different, but it doesn't matter   
   
 ![logo toppharm](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054933im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32746.jpg)

The "TopPharm" logo doesn't look exactly the same, Steven.   
The serif at the apex of the "A" is missing and its cross-bar is   
positioned higher. Also, the tail of the "R" moves away from the   
stem at a greater angle in the "TopPharm" logo than in the mast   
head. The contrast between thick and thin strokes and the angle   
don't match neither.
I know, I want a font with that kind of "R", same style... I don't mind if it isn't exactly the same.

To me it looks like something that could have been designed by   
William Morris or Frederic Goudy.

[Goudy Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/goudy-modern-mt/modern-mt/testdrive.html?s=THE%a0PRAGUE%a0POST&p=48) is in the ballpark. There are some differences, but the overall feel and some of the characters are very close. The long tail on an R is almost always a customization and not a difficult one. There are a few fonts with an R like this, but such a font will not likely match the style in the Prague Post masthead.

Szekeley goulasch???   
   
Where can I buy/find this font?
Any really good Czech or Hungarian restaurant.
